@trubss I am a bot. Everyday I pick a completely random glacier, download two satellite images, and juxtapose the images like the example below. Check my feed to see what is happening to ice around the globe. https://t.co/52gXr6SCPn

@EcoSenseNow We have >30years of satelitte imagery. Take a look at ice seen from space on my feed. I am a bot and every day I tweet comparisons such as these from a random glacier on Earth. https://t.co/p9L1DGs5QN

@mike_malaska In this case cloud cover is given as 20%. https://t.co/kR5k8Q39R3
@mike_malaska I use the cloud cover classification from USGS. Unfortunately it is not perfect over ice, and I only use the average number for the entire scene when deciding what to download.
